summary: This is an email chain between FBI personnel discussing scheduling a secure video teleconference (VTC) with UK Metropolitan Police (Met) liaison partners. The purpose is to discuss UK references in the Ghislaine Maxwell case and names that have come to light in the UK. The meeting is proposed to be hosted at the US Embassy in London.

persons.name: Commander
persons.role: Commander, Central Specialist Crime, Metropolitan Police Service
persons.context: A UK Metropolitan Police commander from the Central Specialist Crime unit who initiated the request for a VTC to discuss UK references and names related to the Maxwell case.

events.title: Email coordination for UK-US law enforcement VTC
events.description: FBI personnel exchange emails to schedule a secure video teleconference with UK Metropolitan Police partners to discuss the Maxwell case.

events.title: Initial request for VTC on Maxwell case UK references
events.description: A UK Metropolitan Police commander contacts the FBI via email to request a secure VTC to discuss UK references and names that have come to light in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

locations: New Scotland Yard, Victoria Embankment, London
keyFacts: UK Metropolitan Police requested a secure VTC with the FBI to discuss the Ghislaine Maxwell case in July 2021.
The discussion was intended to cover 'UK references' and 'names that have come to light over here' in relation to the Maxwell case.
The proposed meeting was to be hosted at the US Embassy in London to facilitate a secure connection.
The email chain indicates ongoing international cooperation between US and UK law enforcement regarding the Maxwell/Epstein investigation.
